```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r, include = FALSE}
av <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fivethirtyeight/data/master/avengers/avengers.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

deaths <- av %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = Death1:Death5, names_to = "Time", values_to = "Death") %>%
  mutate(Time = parse_number(Time),
         Death = ifelse(is.na(Death), "", ifelse(Death == "YES", "yes", "no")))

returns <- av %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = Return1:Return5, names_to = "Time", values_to = "Return") %>%
  mutate(Time = parse_number(Time),
         Return = ifelse(is.na(Return), "", ifelse(Return == "YES", "yes", "no")))
```

Tracie-Lynn Fact Check:</br>
"and on 57 occasions the individual made a comeback." 
```{r, include = FALSE}
new_return<- returns %>% filter(Return == "yes")
new_return<- new_return %>% filter(Name.Alias != "")
unique<- unique(new_return$Name.Alias)
numberofuniquereturns<- length(unique)
```
This statement is FALSE. The number of returns for a unique character is = to `r numberofuniquereturns`.
